question: Question_01_(b)
statement:
What integral is defined by the following expression?

\[\lim_{n\to\infty}\sum_{i=1}^n \frac{\pi}{4n} \tan\left(\frac{i\pi}{4n}\right)\]

(Do not evaluate the integral.)
sols:
We recognize that this has the form of a Riemann sum:

\[\lim_{n \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{i=1}^{n} f(x_i) \Delta x\]

We identify

\[\Delta x = \frac{b-a}{n} = \frac{\pi}{4n}\] and

\[x_i = a + i \Delta x = a + \frac{i \pi}{4n}.\] This gives us that

\[b-a = \frac{\pi}{4}\]

Now, notice that the function in question is $f(x) = \tan(x)$ and so

\begin{align*}
f(x_{i}) &= \tan(x_{i})\\
&= \tan\left(a +  \frac{i \pi}{4n} \right)\\
&= \tan\left( \frac{i \pi}{4n} \right)
\end{align*}

and so we see that we can choose $a = 0$. This gives us that

\[b = b-0 = b-a = \frac{\pi}{4}.\] Hence, the integral is

\[\int_{0}^{\tfrac{\pi}{4}}\tan(x)\, dx\]

completing the question.
hints:
Recall and compare with the definition

$\int_a^b f(x)\,dx = \lim_{n \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{i=1}^n \frac{b-a}{n} f\left(a+\frac{i(b-a)}{n}\right).$
